text: Your environments are in .julia/environments, but you should probably just use a new environment and re-install all your packages. If you have the package in another environment, it will install from cache

elements.text: Your environments are in .julia/environments, but you should probably just use a new environment and re-install all your packages. If you have the package in another environment, it will install from cache

text: No problem with re-installing packages if that's what's recommended.

elements.text: No problem with re-installing packages if that's what's recommended.

text: If you don't have the newest version in the cache, but still don't want to download them all from the internet, you can do `using Pkg; Pkg.offline()` , and then install the packages in the new environment. Then it will not connect to internet

elements.text: If you don't have the newest version in the cache, but still don't want to download them all from the internet, you can do

, and then install the packages in the new environment. Then it will not connect to internet

text: Just to be clear: in general, when updating to a new Julia version, the recommendation is to "re-install" all packages?

text: I'm not very knowledgable about Pkg, but I would do so, because some versions of packages are not compatible with some versions of Julia. So if you don't re-install your packages, you might run into some weird conflicts.
